title: Import error when not installing plots extra and matplotlib already present
body:
I installed 0.38.1 without extras on an environment with matplotlib previously installed, but not IPython.
When importing shap, the plots module is imported because the check in `shap.__init__` is on the presence of `matplotlib`, but `shap.plots._image` imports `IPython` in [line 15](https://github.com/slundberg/shap/blob/master/shap/plots/_image.py#L15) without a try/except block, resulting in an `ModuleNotFoundError`.

Reproducer (on a new Python env):
```sh
$ pip install matplotlib shap
$ python -c 'import shap'
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/home/victor/.pyenv/versions/foo/lib/python3.8/site-packages/shap/__init__.py", line 38, in <module>
    from .plots._beeswarm import summary_legacy as summary_plot
  File "/home/victor/.pyenv/versions/foo/lib/python3.8/site-packages/shap/plots/__init__.py", line 8, in <module>
    from ._image import image, image_to_text
  File "/home/victor/.pyenv/versions/foo/lib/python3.8/site-packages/shap/plots/_image.py", line 15, in <module>
    from IPython.core.display import display, HTML
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'IPython'
```

This seems to have been introduced on an [unrelated commit](https://github.com/vivekchettiar/shap/commit/b60d7faf963ab4ed5f9b7f71b692a48d144a235c) in #1653 that moved the import outside of a function.
